alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, NORTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Milan, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Harrison, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Bright, Hidden Valley, Cleves, Milan, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Taylor Creek, Miami Heights, Blue Jay, Mack, Guilford, Logan, Manchester, New Haven, Grandview, Sunman and Addyston. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 161 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
